events.name: Maker in Residence - Anjali Venkat
events.description: Drop in to join glass artist Anjali Venkat of Anjali Design as she works on the final touches of her mural as part of her Residency at Science Centre Singapore. 2pm to 6pm from 21st to 25th March 2016

events.name: iOS Dev Scout March Meetup
events.description: Speakers: • Hwee Boon Yar - @hboon • Stan Chang Heen Boon - @lxcid • One more speaker (TBD)  Agenda: 6:30pm: Dinner (Sponsored by Hired) 7:15pm: Xcode Tips and Tricks - by Boon 7:45pm: Inspecting 3rd party apps - by Stan 8:15pm: 3rd Technical Talk 8:30pm: Swift / iOS Quiz & Announcements (if any) Sponsors: Dinner is kindly sponsored by https://hired.com  Refer a participating candidate or employer on Hired and score yourself a S$300 travel voucher!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Fireside Chat with John O'Nolan, Founder & CEO, Ghost.org
events.description:
John O’Nolan is the Founder and CEO of Ghost.org, an independent non-profit organization which builds modern open source technology to power the future of online publishing. Ghost is used by the likes of NASA, Mailgun, Envato, Coinable and a whole host of other companies.

In a blog post that was widely shared in the tech community in Singapore, John announced that he’s moving Ghost’s Foundation to Singapore.

Aziza Sheerin, the Regional Director of General Assembly, will host a fireside chat with John O'Nolan, as he shares about the inspiration behind Ghost, his vision for the platform, and why he moved the foundation in Singapore.

Pop by for a great conversation and drinks with the design, developer and entrepreneurial community in Singapore. Sign up for free here - http://bit.ly/GhostSG. 

6:30 - 7:00 PM: Registration
7:00 - 8:00 PM: Fireside Chat
8:00 - 9:00 PM: Drinks!

If you'd like to share thoughts on the chat, tweet us - @GA_Singapore.

events.name: PyData Meetup - March 2016 - Algorithmic Trading + Quantopian
events.description: Agenda  • 6:45pm - 7:20pm Networking • 7:20pm - 7:25pm Pair Data Science idea • 7:25pm - 9pm Presentation: An Algorithmic Trading Introduction Through Pairs Trading by Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie Speaker: Delaney's background is in computer science, math, and statistics. Prior to joining Quantopian, Delaney worked in a bioinformatics lab at Dartmouth researching non-linear genetic interactions. During his time at Quantopian he has facilitated financial engineering workshops in collaboration with professors at MIT, Harvard, Cornell, Stanford, and many other institutions. He curates and interactive online curriculum at https://www.quantopian.com/lectures, and teaches the curriculum at international workshops, including the one at NUS RMI in Singapore this week. Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/  https://engineers.sg/organizations/118https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors    Group Sponsor
events.location: Skyscanner, 39 Robinson Road, #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore 068911
